The Tax Foundation map displayed Tenness: s beer excise tax rates as one of the lowest in the country, ranking 39th with a rate of $0.14 per gallon.
Media reports and a blog post highlighte: s low beer taxes based on the information provided by the map.
Linus Hall: the brewmaster for Yazoo Brewing, disputed the claim on Twitter, stating that Tennessee actually has the highest beer taxes in the country due to an additional 17% wholesale tax.
The Tennessee Malt Beverage Association: representing beer wholesalers, has consistently argued that the taxes paid for beer in Tennessee are among the highest in the nation.
